author: Special Correspondent
text:
The finals of The Hindu Young World Painting Competition 2016, presented by Thyrocare, will be held at Avinashilingam Deemed University on March 20, 2016. The event is an integral part of the Newspaper in Education of The Hindu .

The contest will start at 9.30 a.m. and the shortlisted students should report at the venue by 9 a.m. They should bring the intimation letters sent to them already, along with their school identity cards.

Topics

The topics and drawing sheets will be given at the venue.

The contestants should bring all other materials needed for painting. Sketch pens and marker pens should not be used.

The decision of the judges will be final and binding on all contestants.

The paintings will become the sole property of The Hindu and will not be given back to the contestants. Besides prizes for the top three winners in each category, consolation prizes will also be given.

Dr. Meenakumari Mohan, Consultant Paediatrician, Paediatric Diabetologist and Endocrinologist, is the chief guest at the valediction and will distribute prizes to the winners at 12.30 p.m. at the same venue. Other finalists will be given participation certificates.

The preliminary rounds were held in two categories- Juniors: students of class IV to VI and seniors: classes VII to IX.

Thyrocare is the presenting sponsor for the contest. Avinashilingam Deemed University for women is the venue partner.

The regional sponsors are NSR Bakers and Sweets (snacks partner), Hindustan coca-cola beverages private limited (water partner).
title: The Hindu Young World Painting Contest on March 20
